channel.title: [PI] Highscores saving
channel.description:
Base: DSPK
Problem: Highscore saving from this tutorial: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,364364.0.html
It uses Highscores.save(this); every time you log out which can create some lag if there are tons of people online. How could I make this more efficient and less stress on the server?

item.title: [PI] Highscores saving
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

deathschaos9:

Even with a local database, I’m pretty sure there could still be lag, since I sometimes lag when using a database on my computer. From what I’ve heard, DSPK is a horrible base anyway. :S

it is… Think of it this way DSPK is the Allstarscape of pi based servers.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Highscores saving
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

deathschaos9:

The lag could be caused due to a bad/slow connection to the MySQL database.

I didn’t even think of that.

I am not good with database stuff so this is a guess in the dark, you could solve this by using a local database?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Highscores saving
item.dc:creator: @Sir_Lethal Sir Lethal
item.description:
@Sir_Lethal wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:4, topic:390268”][quote author=Sir Lethal link=topic=486177.msg3562780#msg3562780 date=1302400621]

Check to make sure it is only called on log out, it shouldn’t lag the server if a few people log out…

If you have 200+ on it would lag since multiple people would logout at once.

If I’m correct
[/quote]

Did you fix the memory leak in your DSPK source?[/quote]
Yes, it is fixed

Read full topic
